thread.title: 26-year-old skier dies at Breckenridge Ski Resort – The Denver Post
thread.title_full: 26-year-old skier dies at Breckenridge Ski Resort – The Denver Post

author: The Summit Daily
title: 26-year-old skier dies at Breckenridge Ski Resort – The Denver Post
text:
Andy Cross, The Denver Post Lower Peak 8 area, lower right, at the Breckenridge Ski Resort Saturday, February 4th, 2012. Breckenridge Ski Resort confirmed on Friday evening that a 26-year-old man from Mexico died on an advanced trail that day.
“Breckenridge Ski Resort, Breckenridge Ski Patrol and the entire Vail Resorts family extend our deepest sympathy and support to our guest’s family and friends,” John Buhler, vice president and chief operating officer of the resort, said in a release.
Related Articles January 16, 2017 Denver skier reported missing found dead at Breckenridge Ski Resort January 12, 2017 Skier fatalities: Myths about who dies, and where, debunked January 9, 2017 Fatal chairlift fall at Ski Granby Ranch happened during mechanical problem, state report says Breckenridge Ski Patrol responded to the incident, but after medical care and evaluation the skier was pronounced deceased.
The skier’s name has not been released.
Read the full story at summitdaily.com
